metadata.title: Cutting AI Training Budgets to Preserve Traditional Education Funding
metadata.description: A systems analysis of how cutting AI training budgets to maintain traditional professional development can lead to higher costs through teacher turnover.
metadata.author: Systems Thinking Educational Team

nodes.label: Budget Pressure
nodes.description: Financial constraints forcing difficult choices about professional development spending

nodes.label: AI Training Budget Cuts
nodes.description: Decision to eliminate or reduce AI literacy training for teachers
nodes.measurement: Dollar amount cut from AI training programs

nodes.label: Traditional Program Funding
nodes.description: Maintained or increased funding for established professional development programs
nodes.measurement: Funding allocation to traditional PD programs

nodes.label: Teacher AI Competency
nodes.description: Teachers' ability to effectively use and integrate AI tools in education
nodes.measurement: AI literacy assessment scores, tool usage metrics

nodes.label: Teacher Professional Confidence
nodes.description: Teachers' confidence in their ability to handle modern educational challenges

nodes.label: Teacher Retention Rate
nodes.description: Percentage of teachers remaining in the district year-over-year

nodes.label: Total Staffing Costs
nodes.description: Total cost of recruiting, hiring, and retaining teaching staff

edges.description: Higher budget pressure leads to more AI training cuts
Cutting AI training reduces teacher AI competency

delay.description: Takes time for reduced training to impact competency levels

edges.description: Higher AI competency increases teacher confidence in modern challenges
More confident teachers are more likely to stay in the profession
Higher retention reduces turnover and recruitment costs
Higher staffing costs increase overall budget pressure

delay.description: Budget impacts show up in next fiscal year planning

loops.label: Fixes That Fail Loop
loops.description: Cutting AI training to save money ultimately increases costs through teacher turnover
loops.behavior_pattern: Initial cost savings followed by escalating costs due to turnover
loops.dominance_conditions: When teacher retention becomes critical factor in budget
